In the creation of technical documentation it is common to have pages titled the same under different sections; within Confluence this would be sub pages under different masters. Allowing this behaviour within the Documentation type space would allow the creation of lengthy tech docs without the need to rename headings as well as allowing the import of legacy documentation that may contain like named sections.

An explanation of the current functionality can be found within [CONF-2524].

I'd like to propose implementation of this behaviour within Documentation spaces only.

I have attached an example document tree (pages with a '0' have been renamed). It is not practical to change the headings of these pages as while the content differs, the subsections within the documented site are named alike. This is a common theme throughout our documentation.

fields.description:
We are trying to upgrade from 4.3.6 to 5.4.4.
But the new (in 5.0, I believe) sidebar look and feel disappears if you do anything with a Custom theme.

This is extremely annoying, since we only have a trivial amount of theming. We want to stick as closely as possible to Confluence style, but must do some basic branding that cannot be done without a theme.

Basically this is a show-stopper to our upgrade.

I attach a .jar that contains a "theme" that only sets two colours but which illustrates the loss of sidebar.

It also illustrates the loss of footer - please also see https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-33079 about that.

h2. Workaround

To display the default Confluence sidebar in your custom theme, you must add a "{{space-ia}}" configuration value to your {{atlassian-plugin.xml}}, like this:

{code:lang=xml}
 <theme key="my-theme" name="My Custom Theme" class="com.atlassian.confluence.themes.BasicTheme">
	<space-ia value="true"/>
  </theme>
{code}
fields.summary: Confluence 5.x sidebar disappears if you have a custom theme

  {panel}

h6. Steps to create the situation
# Create a page in Space 'A'
# The new page should be named with Special Character so that the URL to access the page will be the non-pretty URL (/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=xxxxxxx)
# Put a view restriction to the new page so that only the author can see it
# Create a new user 'Sam'

h6. Situation:
'Sam' has just joined the company. He is given the link to the new page ({{<base-URL>/pages.viewpage.action?pageId=xxxxxxx}}). However, he doesn't have permission to view the page. He needs the Space Administrator's help to add him to the page's view restriction so that he can view the page. But there's no way for him to know the Space name or where the view restriction is applied (same page or parent page) in order to inform the Space Administrator.
The Space Administrator/Sam needs to contact the DBA to find out the page name, space name, and page restriction by providing the pageId.

h6. Summary:
This procedure is time-consuming and inefficient because the user needs to find DBA every time this kind of scenario is encountered. It'll be great improvement in Confluence if there's more information provided in the restricted page such as:
- Space location
- Page that prevent access to it
- Page name

These informations can be used by Confluence Administrator or Space Administrator to grant access to a restricted page without having to contact the DBA.
fields.summary: More Information from Restricted Page with Non-pretty URL in Order to Request Admin Permission

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33035].
  {panel}

_This was originally posted as CORE-196, but since i don't have access to edit my own submission under CORE, and it isn't indexed by search engines, i probably wasn't supposed to (be able to) submit tickets there.  This is an SDK issue, and thus spans confluence, jira, and others, but there's no SDK project that i have permission to update, so please move this ticket to the right place if necessary.  Instead of simply leaving the ticket where it was and letting Atlassian update/move it as desired, i'm re-posting here, because i'd like this issue to be indexed by search engines so that others can discover it when they have similar concerns._

I downloaded atlassian-plugin-sdk-4.2.18.tar.gz, and the permissions are all wrong. I'd have checked the .deb or .rpm versions as well, but Atlassian doesn't offer direct download links for them.

Some files have an arbitrary UID. I imagine that this is the UID of the user someone from Atlassian uses to create the files. Note UID 502 (GID 20), below.
{code}
>>> ls -l
total 16
drwxr-xr-x  7 root root 4096 Mar 24 13:14 apache-maven
drwxr-xr-x  2 root root 4096 Mar 24 13:14 bin
-rwxrwxrwx  1  502   20    3 Feb 25 16:37 installtype.txt
drwxr-xr-x 42 root root 4096 Mar 24 13:14 repository

>>> ls -l repository 
total 160
drwxrwxrwx  3 502 20 4096 Feb 25 16:37 args4j
drwxrwxrwx  5 502 20 4096 Feb 25 16:37 asm
drwxrwxrwx  3 502 20 4096 Feb 25 16:37 backport-util-concurrent
drwxrwxrwx  3 502 20 4096 Feb 25 16:37 biz
drwxrwxrwx  3 502 20 4096 Feb 25 16:37 classworlds
...
{code}

Some files and directories are group- and world-writable. This includes directories and .jar files. Very bad for installation on a multiuser system.
{code}
>>> find . -perm -022 -print |head
./apache-maven/lib
./apache-maven/lib/maven-trap-0.5.jar
./apache-maven/lib/maven-2.1.0-uber.jar
./apache-maven/boot
./apache-maven/boot/classworlds-1.1.jar
./apache-maven/bin
./apache-maven/bin/m2.conf
./apache-maven/maven-docs/NOTICE.txt
./apache-maven/maven-docs/README.txt
./apache-maven/maven-docs/LICENSE.txt

>>> find . -perm -002 -print |wc -l
2147
{code}

Files intended for execution are only executable by the owner (mode 0744). Files meant to be executed by local users should be mode 0755 (or, if they're binaries, at least mode 0711). On the other hand, files not intended for execution should not have the executable bit set (see: m2.conf, .txt files, .jar files, etc.).
{code}
>>> ls -l bin
total 288
-rwxr--r-- 1 502 20  1645 Feb 25 16:37 atlas-clean
-rwxr--r-- 1 502 20  3650 Feb 25 16:37 atlas-cli
-rwxr--r-- 1 502 20 10228 Feb 25 16:37 atlas-clover
-rwxr--r-- 1 502 20  1619 Feb 25 16:37 atlas-compile
-rwxr--r-- 1 502 20  4215 Feb 25 16:37 atlas-create-bamboo-plugin
...

>>> ls -l apache-maven/bin 
total 36
-rwxrwxrwx 1 502 20  145 Mar 18  2009 m2.conf
-rwxr--r-- 1 502 20 4908 Feb 25 16:37 mvn
-rwxr--r-- 1 502 20 5915 Mar 18  2009 mvn.bat
-rwxr--r-- 1 502 20 4743 Mar 18  2009 mvnDebug
-rwxr--r-- 1 502 20 6100 Mar 18  2009 mvnDebug.bat
{code}

The release shown above could be sanitized by running something like the following from the root of the tree:
{code}
>>> chown -R root:root .
>>> find . -type f -perm -002 -print |xargs chmod 644
>>> find . -type d -perm -002 -print |xargs chmod 755
>>> find . -type f -perm -0100 -print |xargs chmod 755
{code}

You guys should probably do something of the sort (with modifications that will work properly with your typical release cycle) before packaging the files for distribution.
fields.summary: Atlassian SDK permissions are all wrong

fields.description:
To reproduce:

Browse to a wiki article, click Edit, click the Link button, click Attachments, and attempt to upload an attachment. The attachment should be larger than the maximum allowed attachment size. The file will upload, then Confluence will show the user an error saying "Could not upload the file to Confluence. The server may be unavailable." No corresponding error will be written to atlassian-confluence.log at all.

The error provided to the user, and the lack of any error at all in the logs, make this difficult for an admin to troubleshoot.

The desired behavior happens if you browse to an article, go to the Attachments section, and upload the same file through the Attachments section. Confluence will display a "file too large" error to the user and will produce a "java.io.IOException: Content Length Error" in the log.

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33023].
  {panel}

Conflluence is a great product; I recommend it widely.  However lack of traditional wiki markup in more recent versions is a large gap.

The push to WYSIWYG editing is understandable for the product goals stated in support, but neglects traditional users who prefer wiki markup.  Previous versions of Confluence supported both.

Use cases include:

* Accessibility (WYSIWYG often requires greater mouse use)
* Large edits outside Conflulence (e.g., vi or sed of markup)
* Portable edits between systems
* User preference

Please provide traditional wiki markup for roundtrip editing.
fields.summary: Support wiki markup in editor

fields.description:
h3.Steps to Reproduce
# Create an Application Link between Confluence and JIRA
# Set the Display URL to a non-existent address, or to a proxy address that is reachable from the client's browser, but not accessible from the Confluence Server itself (the whole point of having an Application URL / Display URL separation)
# Create a page and add a JIRA issue into the page
# Export the page to PDF

You will notice Errors such as these:
{code}
2014-03-22 17:57:51,167 WARN [http-8542-1] [confluence.extra.flyingpdf.ConfluenceExportUserAgent] getImageResource Could not retrieve image resource http://192.168.2.3:8614/jira614/images/icons/statuses/open.png during Confluence export
 -- url: /c542/spaces/flyingpdf/pdfpageexport.action | page: 1933317 | userName: admin | referer: http://localhost:8542/c542/display/GIE/sa+dasd+as+d+assad | action: pdfpageexport
{code}
It seems that the getImageResource will attempt to obtain /images/icons/statuses/open.png via the Display URL, and not the Application URL. The Confluence Server is unable to reach the Display URL, hence, the error

h3.Workaround
Set the Display URL to a URL that the Confluence Server is able to reach
fields.summary: PDF Export Retrieves Images From JIRA Macros via the Display URL and not the Application URL

fields.description:
If your Confluence is using the wrong collation in Microsoft SQL Server it *shouldn't* be possible to upgrade to version 5.2.3  or latest due the constraint check we added to block the upgrade, however those constraints are no longer working because the upgrade is no longer being blocked as it used to.

h4. Steps to reproduce:
# Set up  a Confluence under version 5.2.3.
# Make sure to use the "SQL_Latin1_General_CP1_CI_AS" collation instead of "SQL_Latin1_General_CP1_CS_AS".
# Once this Confluence is up and running, upgrade it to version 5.2.3 or latest.
# The upgrade should fail due the constraint's we added around user mapping table, however it will work without problems.

h4. Diagnostic
Run the below query against your Confluence MS SQL server database:
{code:SQL}
SELECT object_name(object_id) as TableName, name as ColumnName, collation_name
FROM sys.columns
WHERE collation_name <> 'SQL_Latin1_General_CP1_CS_AS'
AND object_name(object_id) NOT LIKE 'sys%' 
AND object_name(object_id) NOT LIKE 'queue%'
AND object_name(object_id) NOT LIKE 'file%'
{code}
If the above return any results means your database is using the wrong collation.

h4. Work Around
There are a few know methods we suggest our customers to use to address this:
(!) *Always* have a backup of your database before trying any of the below work around.
(i) Below methods will require some database knowledge in MsSQL Server, if possible engage your DBA in below activities.
# The resolution method provided in [this|https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=412483920] KB which is not feasible to large instances since it relies on XML backup to create a clone instance.
# Install a fresh Confluence in the same version, making sure that this version is with the right collation as per our [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Database+Setup+for+SQL+Server]. After that dummy instance is up do a few actions in this instance (like and watch a page to create a few AO tables) then use a data migration tool to migrate the data from the instance with the wrong collation to the dummy instance that should be using the correct collation.
# Follow this [guide|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Collation+Conflict+When+Creating+Pages] that teaches on how to manually fix the problem, which is a manual task and will be a very time consuming activity.
# Atlassian Experts, since they can provide a hands on assistance to address this (their services will be subject to a quote).
# The [collation changer tool|http://www.codeproject.com/Articles/12753/SQL-Server-2000-Collation-Changer], which is a non supported tool that might result in data loss.
(i) We had good feedback from customers that tried the above tool, they didn't had nay data loss and the tool worked against SQL Server 2k5,2k8 and 2k12, even with those feedbacks this tool still should be used as a last resort, in case you decide for this option  you will be using it at their own risk.
fields.summary: Confluence is not blocking the Upgrade if MS SQL has the wrong collation.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-32999].
  {panel}

Currently you can share a page with Internal users or any arbitrary e-mail address with the assumption that the receiver will in some way have access to the page (either because they are a user with permission, or because the page is public).

It would be useful to have a feature that is similar in nature to Google Drive's "Anyone with the link" visibility settings on a document. This would allow a page to still appear hidden from anonymous access (through the normal friendly URLs), but would build a unique (obscure) link so you can share the page with a known set of public (anonymous) users.

Something like:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/?key=ca30863e401056a22be7244155b8a6e8

Adding users just to share one or two "semi-public" articles is costly. I can see many cases where you may not want anyone from the outside world to easily find an article (i.e. general anonymous access), but you would want to provide a direct link to a group of trusted individuals.
fields.summary: Ability to share a page to an anonymous user with a private URL

fields.description:
If your Confluence is being upgraded while using a Microsoft SQL Server database configured with the wrong collation, all the page watchers will no longer appear in the UI. 

h4. Steps to reproduce:
# Setup  a Confluence under version 5.2.3.
# Make sure to use the "SQL_Latin1_General_CP1_CI_AS" collation instead of "SQL_Latin1_General_CP1_CS_AS".
# Once this Confluence is up and running, add a few pages and create a few users.
# Watch the pages with those new users.
(i) At this point everything will work fine.
!beforeUpUI.PNG|thumbnail!
# Upgrade Confluence to Confluence 5.4.3 (or latest).
# Log on with one of the created users in step 3.
# If you go to a page you watched you will see that your user is no longer watching that page.
!afterUpUI.PNG|thumbnail!

h4. Diagnostic

Run the below query against your Confluence MS SQL server database:
{code:SQL}
SELECT object_name(object_id) as TableName, name as ColumnName, collation_name
FROM sys.columns
WHERE collation_name <> 'SQL_Latin1_General_CP1_CS_AS'
AND object_name(object_id) NOT LIKE 'sys%' 
AND object_name(object_id) NOT LIKE 'queue%'
AND object_name(object_id) NOT LIKE 'file%'
{code}

If the above return any results means your database is using the wrong collation.

h4. Notes 
If the users re add themselves as watchers the function will work normally.
In the UI the user is no longer watching a page after the upgrade, however we are still able to see data in the notifications table:
Before Upgrading:
!beforeUp.PNG|thumbnail!
After Upgrading:
!afterUp.PNG|thumbnail!

h4. Workaround
# Restore your pre-upgrade backups
# Fix the collation in the database by following the steps [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Collation+Conflict+When+Creating+Pages]
# While you're there, ensure everything else in [this document|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Database+Setup+for+SQL+Server] is set correctly
# Try the upgrade again

NB: Once the upgrade is done the watches will be lost and there is no way to retrieve them. You must restore your backups from before the upgrade and start the process again.
fields.summary: Upgrading Confluence with a wrong collation on Microsoft SQL causes watches to be lost in all pages.

fields.description:
Currently, JIRA issues can be created directly by highlighting a text on a Confluence page. Furthermore, multiple issues can be created from highlighted text in a table. 

h5. Scenario
It is discovered that if we are to create JIRA issues from a second table, the issues were not added into the table. On JIRA side, issues were created successfully without any error. The following error message will occurs:
{noformat}
xxx issues has been created, but there are problems in adding them to the page. You can manually add them later using JIRA macro.
{noformat}
Please refer to attachment {{CSP119754-JIRA_Issues_on_2nd_table.png}} for more details.

h5. Steps to reproduce
Consider the following steps to reproduce the issue:
# Create a table with 5 rows and add random text on each rows
# Highlight the text on the first row and click on JIRA icon
# Select to create 5 issues on the table
# Observe that 5 issues is created and added into the table
# Create another table with 5 rows and add random text
# Highlight the text on the first row and click on JIRA icon
# Select to create 5 issues on the table
# The error message will be displayed and nothing is added on the second table
# Observe that the JIRA issues are successfully created on JIRA side

This issue can be reproduced locally on test instance.

h5. Expected result

It is expected that the JIRA issues are successfully created on JIRA side and added correctly to the table

Thank you and regards,
Lazuardi
fields.summary: JIRA issues were not added to Confluence page if they were created from the second table

fields.description:
In newer versions of the Confluence source code (approx. 5.2+), there's a limitation in the search engine API that can only return 100k results. The requests are typically paged and pages over 100k item boundary. Additionally the page size is limited silently to 500.

This fact should be mentioned in the documentation. (https://developer.atlassian.com/display/CONFDEV/Remote+Confluence+Methods#RemoteConfluenceMethods-Search)
fields.summary: Documentation of Confluence API Search Result Limitation

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-32983].
  {panel}

_Problem_
Catpcha is not enough to prevent spam. If enabled, anonymous spam comments become soon a huge problem, with hundreds of spam every week. Spammers just want to increase their websites google ranking with referrals, so they wont' stop.
Related issues CONF-13081 and CONF-31962 are not enough.
More details here: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Preventing+and+Cleaning+Up+Spam

_Solution_
Anonymous comment moderation. For each comment a notification is sent by email with two buttons: Approve | Reject. If approved, the comment is posted. If not, it's just rejected.
fields.summary: Anonymous comment moderation

fields.description:
h3. Step to reproduce
# Create a status report or change log page with JIRA report plugin
# Navigate to the JIRA Reports page created in the page.

h3. Observed Result.
The JIRA Reports pagein the space  does not displayed the pages created with the blue print.
!sample.png|witdh:100!


h3. Cause

The page properties macro in JIRA Reports page is configured to display pages with label "jirareport" but the pages created with JIRA Report Change log and Status Report  is configured with the label changelog and statusreport in their  respective Page Properties macro. 


h3. Workaround 
*  Create 2 Page Properties Report macro  in JIRA Reports Index template and configured them to display "changelog" and "statusreport" label respectively.
* Edit the  page properties macro in Snapshot JIRA Report Template, Dynamic JIRA Report Template and Status Report Template label to "jirareport"
